node.statement: CHAIN RULE AT ROOTS: At each root lambda_i of r, omega_p(lambda_i) = mu_sigma(i) for a bijection sigma (omega_p maps roots of r to roots of p). The derivative omega_p'(lambda_i) = 1 [Proved in ex6 via implicit differentiation]. The correction is alpha_i = omega_p''(lambda_i)/2. Therefore H_r(lambda_i) = H_p(mu_sigma(i)) - alpha_i. Setting u_i = H_p(mu_sigma(i)) and h_i = H_r(lambda_i), we have h = u - alpha and Phi_n(p) = ||u||^2, Phi_n(r) = ||h||^2. Similarly h = v - beta with v from q.
